concept_data.title: United Nations Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute
concept_data.preferred_term: UN Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute

summary: The "UN Interregional Crime and Justice Research Institute" (UNICRI) is a specialized agency of the United Nations, focusing on crime prevention and justice reform. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, UNICRI plays a pivotal role in fostering international cooperation and providing empirical research to enhance the efficacy of justice systems. The Institute's work aligns with EU objectives to combat transnational crime and promote the rule of law. As a redirect to the preferred term, it underscores the importance of interregional collaboration in addressing complex legal challenges, thereby supporting EU member states in their regulatory efforts to uphold justice and security.
